duties_responsibilities.duty: Greet clients and patients, obtain weight and vital signs, and record the electronic medical record.
Assist with appointments, surgery, dentistry, and euthanasia under supervision.
Process laboratory samples, handle and dispense medications, and maintain electronic medical records.
Schedule appointments, provide client education, and maintain client/patient records.
Prepare patients for surgical and dental procedures, anesthetize patients, monitor patients during recovery, and prepare for discharge.
Perform in-hospital treatments for sick patients, assist in the training of new staff members, and maintain hospital environment neat and clean.
Provide backup phone and front desk support as needed.

education_certification.credential: 1 year previous experience working in veterinary practice or sufficient relatable animal care experience
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Compassion, sympathy, and ability to maintain a professional attitude and demeanor during emotional and stressful situations
Team player willing to learn new techniques and treatments, offer creative ideas, and accept change
